statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem graphically}\\ \text{Minimise } Z=x+2y \\ \text{subject to the constraints} \\ 2x+y \ge 3,\, x+2y \ge 6,\, x ,\, y \ge 0

step.context: \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?}
step.reason: \text{Given the constraints the area would be }\\ \text{restricted by the X and Y axes, }\\ \text{and the area above } 2x+y=3 \text{ and }x+2y=6 \\ \text{Note inequalities are } \ge\text{ not }\le

step.context: \text{What is the value of the Minimum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?}
step.reason: \text{Minimum is calculated by substituting}\\ \text{the correct corner points into the }\\ \text{objective function } Z=x+2y \\ \text{Here minimum is at all points joining (0, 3) and (6, 0)}

choices.tex: \text{Minimum } 6\text{ is at all points from (0, 3) to (6, 0)}
